alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 9:19PM CDT until July 15 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD...SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SEQUOYAH... SOUTHERN ADAIR AND SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 919 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Strickler to near Vian, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Muldrow... Roland... Vian... Gore... Gans... Marble City... Rudy... Adair State Park... Brushy... Pumpkin Center... Maryetta... Cookson... Brushy Lake State Park... Lee Creek... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 288 and 328. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 32. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
